(1 comment)
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as f48015b39f945c2f9534e674819bdfef7b6c7054

DSP0248 described `eventIDToAcknowledge` should be 0x0000 for the `GetFirstPart` of a multipart event[1]. And `decode_pldm_message_poll_event_data`[2] that doesn't allow to assign as 0x0000.

If `pollEventId` comes from `pollForPlatformEventMessage` cmd, then it should allow assigning eventId as 0x0000 in libpldm.

[1] https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/src/dsp/platform.c#L1087
[2] https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/src/dsp/platform.c#L2070

> DSP0248 described `eventIDToAcknowledge` should be 0x0000 for the `GetFirstPart` of a multipart event[1]. And `decode_pldm_message_poll_event_data`[2] that doesn't allow to assign as 0x0000.
> 

I agree. I will update the code.

> If `pollEventId` comes from `pollForPlatformEventMessage` cmd, then it should allow assigning eventId as 0x0000 in libpldm.

> 
> [1] https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/src/dsp/platform.c#L1087

I will review the libpldm concern `PollForPlatformEventMessage` again and update the code.

> [2] https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/src/dsp/platform.c#L2070

This API `decode_pldm_message_poll_event_data ` follows the table `Table 25 – pldmMessagePollEvent class eventData format` in DMTF DSP0248 V1.3.0, as the `eventID` `This value shall be between 0x0001 and 0xFFFE, inclusive` So the condition is corrected.
The `encode/decode_poll_for_platform_event_message_req` APIs is updated on patch set https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/74855

I updated the code `pollForPlatformEventMessage` to follow the DMTF DSP0248 V1.3.0 spec.
Please check.
Thanks for the fix.

as this sentence `If the
PollForPlatformEventMessage command is executed because of a eventData format for
pldmMessagePollEvent, this will be the dataTransferHandle value returned from the
pldmMessagePollEvent.` in `Table 16 – PollForPlatformEventMessage command format` of DSP0248, the `dataTransferHandle` in `pldmMessagePollEvent` eventClass will be inputed as parameter of `PollForPlatformEventMessage` methods.
I updated code in patch set version #12 to support that.
If `TransferOperationFlag` is `AcknowledgeOnly`, `eventIdToAcknowledge` should be `eventId` from PLDM terminus response to ack, right?
As `Figure 22 – Switching from asynchronous eventing to poll for an event with large data`, the eventIdToAcknowledge should be 0xffff when TransferOperationFlag is AcknowledgeOnly.

It looks like an issue in Figure 22. In Table 16, eventIDToAcknowledge mentioned for acking an event previously received and 0xFFFF should use when in the middle of a multipart event transfer (GetNextPart).

I think you are right.
As DSP0248 V1.3.0, `Figure 22 - Switching from asynchronous eventing to
poll for an event with large data` when the `tranferFlag` of
`PollForPlatformEventMessage` is `AcknowledgementOnly` the
`eventIDToAcknowledge` will be 0xffff.

But the contents in lines #1678 to #1681 of the same specs details
```
1678 0x0000 shall be returned to indicate the terminus event queue is empty. The PLDM Event Receiver shall
1679 acknowledge reception of the event by issuing the command again with the eventIDToAcknowledge set
1680 to the previously retrieved eventID (from the PLDM terminus). The PLDM terminus shall remove the
1681 acknowledged event message from its internal FIFO upon reception of the acknowledgment
```

When the `tranferFlag` is `AcknowledgementOnly` the
`eventIDToAcknowledge` should be `the previously retrieved eventID (from
the PLDM terminus)` which is not 0x0000 and 0xffff. Because `The PLDM
terminus shall remove the acknowledged event message` so the contents in
lines #1678 to #1681 are correct.

I updated the checking for eventIDToAcknowledge  when tranferFlag is AcknowledgementOnly https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/74953
Please help checking.

The code in this patch set is also updated.
Thanks for the fix.
Verified with meta-arm-evb system.

use more modern way to of initialization ?

```
pldm_message_poll_event poll_event {};

```
Done
Done
can you please remove `// Reference for clarity` comment - i just wrote it to explain you, i think its not needed to be in the code.
whats the need for it when we are not using it ? can add it when we need it ?

In the previous patch set, I set `pollEventId` to `eventIdToAcknowledge` that why `pollEventId` is required. But it is not correct with the spec. 
I removed `pollEventId`
can we remove it stating the reason's in a new commit ? and drop the changes for these here ?

It just a patch set version #12 in this patch set https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/73033/11..13/platform-mc/event_manager.hpp#103.
So it is still a part of this patch set.
Acknowledged
magic numbers ? any way we could have named constants for these ?
Done
can we have rest of these initialized as well ?
Done
merge these two to single if ?

I think we should not.
The line #535 and #545 is one if ... else pair which check the  transferOperationFlag == PLDM_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_ONLY.
While `if (eventId == PLDM_PLATFORM_EVENT_ID_ACK)` is used to check eventId only as the condition `transferOperationFlag == PLDM_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_ONLY`.
Merge two line to one will cause the `else` at #545 will also `true` when ( `transferOperationFlag == PLDM_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_ONLY` && `eventId != PLDM_PLATFORM_EVENT_ID_ACK`).
Acknowledged
merge these two to elseif() ?

`else` at line #545 is pair of `if ... else ... ` which check condition `transferOperationFlag == PLDM_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_ONLY`.

While `if` at line #547 and else at line #554 is pair of `if ... else ...` which checking value of `transferFlag`.
So we should not merge those two lines.
can we atleast split these into multiple functions ? its really hard to follow through the if-else-if statements.
Updated.
Check my comment above.
Acknowledged
arj has been advocating to placement new in all the libpldm reviews - instead of using the reinterpret_cast<>, can you try using that ??

`terminusManager.sendRecvPldmMsg` requires `request` as `std:vector<uint8_t>`. While `encode_poll_for_platform_event_message_req` require `struct pldm_msg *`.

I can update to construct `requestMsg` use `PLDM_MSG_DEFINE_P(requestMsg, PLDM_POLL_FOR_PLATFORM_EVENT_MESSAGE_REQ_BYTES);` but we still need construct `request` from `requestMsg`.

I don't see much help of using `PLDM_MSG_DEFINE_P` instead of `reinterpret_cast<pldm_msg*>` in this case.

Let me know your idea.

`PLDM_MSG_DEFINE_P()` isn't magic, you can look at its implementation. There should be no reason to require `reinterpret_cast<>()` here. You can use:

```
auto requestMsg = new (request.data()) pldm_msg;
```

So long as the alignment requirements are met by `request.data()`. If it's backed by a vector then the data object should be heap-allocated, in which case the alignment requirement is satisfied (heap pointers must have the strongest alignment).
Done
Done
why do we initialise all here and then again re-initialize them below ? can we split them and intialize few here and few below ?
Done
The eventHandlers will be triggered after send ACK to the terminus in latest patch set number #17.

LGTM.
Handle event after send ACK to terminus.
